lead_paragraph: To the Editor: Re ''E.R. Doctors Face Dilemma on Painkillers'' (May 1): When I was a surgical intern at North Shore University Hospital, dental emergencies were under the domain of the surgery department. I spent a few months in the emergency department, so I was confronted with numerous patients with dental pain. I consulted a textbook and quickly learned about dental blocks. Such local anesthetic injections provided immediate pain relief that is sustained for many hours, most often obviating the need for narcotic prescriptions.
